00094     /**
00095      * Unify line breaks
00096      * 
00097      * This method converts Macintosh & DOS line breaks to standard Unix
00098      * line breaks. This means replacing CR (u000D / chr(13)) and CR + LF
00099      * (u000D + u000A / chr(13) + chr( 10 )) by LF (u000A / chr( 10 )). It also
00100      * replace LF + CR (u000A + u000D / chr( 10 ) + chr(13)) sequences. By
00101      * default, the function erases all ASCII null characters (u0000 / chr(0)).
00102      * 
00103      * @param   string  The text to process
00104      * @param   boolean If set, erases ASCII null characters
00105      * @return  string  The text with standard Unix line breaks
00106      */
00107     public function unifyLineBreaks( $text, $stripNull = true )
00108     {
00109         // Strip ASCII null character?
00110         if( $stripNull ) {
00111             
00112             // Erases ASCII null characters
00113             $text = str_replace( $this->_asciiTable[ 0 ], '', $text );
00114         }
00115         
00116         // DOS CR + LF (u000D + u000A / chr(13) + chr( 10 ))
00117         $text = str_replace(
00118             $this->_asciiTable[ 13 ] . $this->_asciiTable[ 10 ],
00119             $this->_asciiTable[ 10 ],
00120             $text
00121         );
00122         
00123         // LF + CR (u000A + u000D / chr( 10 ) + chr(13))
00124         $text = str_replace(    
00125             $this->_asciiTable[ 10 ] . $this->_asciiTable[ 13 ],
00126             $this->_asciiTable[ 10 ],
00127             $text
00128         );
00129         
00130         // Macintosh CR (u000D / chr(13))
00131         $text = str_replace(
00132             $this->_asciiTable[ 13 ],
00133             $this->_asciiTable[ 10 ],
00134             $text
00135         );
00136         
00137         // Return text
00138         return $text;
00139     }

00141     /**
00142      * Gets an HTML list from a string
00143      * 
00144      * @param   string              The string to process
00145      * @param   string              The separator for the list items
00146      * @param   string              The list tag (ul or ol)
00147      * @return  tx_oop_Xhtml_Tag    The HTML list
00148      */
00149     public function strToList( $str, $sep = ',', $listType = 'ul' )
00150     {
00151         // Gets all the list items
00152         $items = explode( $sep, $str );
00153         
00154         // Creates the list tag
00155         $list = new tx_oop_Xhtml_Tag( $listType );
00156         
00157         // Process each list item
00158         foreach( $items as $item ) {
00159             
00160             // Adds the list item to the list tag
00161             $list->li = trim( $item );
00162         }
00163         
00164         // Returns the list tag
00165         return $list;
00166     }

00168     /**
00169      * Crops a string.
00170      * 
00171      * This function is used to crop a string to a specified number of
00172      * characters. By default, it crops the string after an entire word, and not
00173      * in the middle of a word. It also strips by default all HTML tags before
00174      * cropping, to avoid display problems.
00175      * 
00176      * @param   string  The string to crop
00177      * @param   int     The number of characters to keep
00178      * @param   string  The string to add after the cropped string
00179      * @param   boolean If set, don't crop in a middle of a word
00180      * @param   boolean If set, removes all HTML tags from the string before cropping
00181      * @return  string  The cropped string
00182      */
00183     function crop( $str, $chars, $endString = '...', $crop2space = true, $stripTags = true )
00184     {
00185         // Checks the string length
00186         if( strlen( $str ) < $chars ) {
00187             
00188             // Returns the string
00189             return $str;
00190         }
00191         
00192         // Remove HTML tags?
00193         if( $stripTags ) {
00194             
00195             // Removes all tags
00196             $str = strip_tags( $str );
00197         }
00198         
00199         // Checks the string length
00200         if( strlen( $str ) < $chars ) {
00201             
00202             // Returns the string
00203             return $str;
00204             
00205         } else {
00206             
00207             // Substring
00208             $str = substr( $str, 0, $chars );
00209             
00210             // Crops only after a word?
00211             if( $crop2space && strstr( $str, ' ' ) ) {
00212                 
00213                 // Position of the last space
00214                 $cropPos = strrpos( $str, ' ' );
00215                 
00216                 // Crops the string
00217                 $str     = substr( $str, 0, $cropPos );
00218             }
00219             
00220             // Returns the string
00221             return $str . $endString;
00222         }
00223     }
